questions.question: CODATECN-REC is documented as io_type 'PARAMETER' with citations 90,223,231, but line 90 places it in WORKING-STORAGE via COPY CODATECN with no LINKAGE SECTION or external parameter evidence (preprocessors shows empty linkage_items). Is this an input or internal working storage?

Paragraphs section lists only high-level and error paragraphs (e.g., 1000-ACCTFILE-GET-NEXT at 165), but omits sub-paragraphs called within it like 1100-DISPLAY-ACCT-RECORD (line 200), 1300-POPUL-ACCT-RECORD (215), 1350-WRITE-ACCT-RECORD (242). Should these be documented separately?
What about explicit CLOSE for output files OUT-FILE, ARRY-FILE, VBRC-FILE? Only 9000-ACCTFILE-CLOSE for input is performed (line 156), with no paragraphs or error handling for output closes.

In data_flow writes_to ARRY-FILE, fields_written lists ARR-ACCT-CURR-BAL and ARR-ACCT-CURR-CYC-DEBIT generically, but source populates specific OCCURS indices 1-3 with hardcodes/moves (lines 255-260), leaving 4-5 uninitialized after INITIALIZE (168). Does this accurately reflect the data flow?
Source line 233 has MOVE CODATECN-0UT-DATE (with '0UT' possibly a typo for 'OUT'), documented as CODATECN-OUT-DATE in BR002 and data_flow. What is the exact field name from CODATECN copybook?

CODATECN-REC is documented as io_type 'PARAMETER' input (citations 90,223,231), but line 90 is COPY CODATECN in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION with no LINKAGE SECTION or external evidence (preprocessing confirms empty linkage_items). Line 223 moves input date to CODATECN-INP-DATE and WS-REISSUE-DATE before internal CALL. Should this be reclassified as working storage, not input?

No PERFORM, paragraph, or error handling for CLOSE on output files OUT-FILE (line 35), ARRY-FILE (40), VBRC-FILE (45); only input ACCTFILE-FILE closed in 9000-ACCTFILE-CLOSE (line 156 PERFORMed at 156). What about output file closes and potential error handling?

Business rules BR002 and data_flow transforms reference 'CODATECN-OUT-DATE', but source line 233 has 'CODATECN-0UT-DATE' (zero instead of O). Is this a source typo, copybook field name, or documentation error?

ARRY-FILE data_flow writes_to lists ARR-ACCT-CURR-BAL (1-3) and ARR-ACCT-CURR-CYC-DEBIT (1-3), but source INITIALIZE ARR-ARRAY-REC (168) zeros all 5 OCCURS, populates only 1-3 (255-260), leaving 4-5 zero. Should documentation note uninitialized/zeroed indices 4-5?

VBRC-FILE BR004 and data_flow reference WS-ACCT-REISSUE-YYYY (line 282 MOVE), but this extracts YYYY from WS-REISSUE-DATE which receives input ACCT-REISSUE-DATE (224), before COBDATFT formats CODATECN-OUT-DATE (231,233). Purpose mentions date transformation, but VB2 uses pre-format YYYY from input - is this accurate or post-format intended?
